reviews.sentence: The Ritz Carlton is in a different league. Ritz Carlton takes the hotel experience to a whole different level. From the moment when you arrive you can be sure to expect top class service. I only said my name once and from then on all the members of staff remembered it I do not know how they do it. My room was not ready when I arrived so I sat down in reception and waited. I was offered both complimentary mimosas and bottled water whilst I waited. Extra touches like this really adds to the experience. The room was lovely and had everything you needed. The spa was great too they offer you complimentary mimosas here as well whilst you wait. The pool area is just wonderful. Highly recommended.
Fantastic location. Staff on the beach as well as at the hotel were amazing. Staff very welcoming. Great fitness center. Location is perfect.

They do not call it the Ritz for nothing. I have stayed at many of the Titz properties for work and leisure and they never disappoint. The service is impeccable from the checking to the spa treatments. Marco the the front office manager took great care in ensuring our stay was comfortable and five star. The wait staff from the pool to th beach and in between we are phenomnenal. There is no other place for us than the Ritz. can not wait to go backThat I had to leave. Lol.

Should be rated much higher. I had stayed at the Ritz Carlton but did not take full advantage of the hotel. I was upgraded to a one bedroom one and a half bath suite overlooking the ocean with two terraces. Sweet. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable as was the living room. The bathroom was large and luxurious. The pool and restaurant are wonderful and service is outstanding. The location is central to South Beach shopping and activities. I would say the excellent service added greatly to my stay. I will be back in September.

The Spa. I love this spa. the La Carita pedicure is amazing as is the Raindrop technique massage which utilizes Young Living Essential oils. Everything about this spa is first class all the way. The staff is friendly the therapists are top notch. This is on my list of top two favorite spas on Miami.

The Only Place To Stay. From the moment you arrive all is taken care of. I was upgraded to a beautiful suite with a massive elegant bathroom and extra half bath. The lobby is comfortable and inviting. The pool great music food drinks. Dia and Jonathan provided amazing service. Great on site gym. It is my third visit to the Ritz and having stayed at probably ten different hotels this is a keeper.

Great Location with Pampering. I spent 3 days at the Ritz Southbeach. I was here for a conference but wish I could have stayed longer. Every staff member seemed to go above and beyond to be friendly and make sure guests were comfortable. I am not sure but it appeared that housekeeping came about 3 times a day. Bed was extremely comfortable and bath items were plentiful. Great restaurants nightlife and shopping within walking distance. Southbeach has a wonderful brick pathway beachside so I was able to keep up exercise with a beautiful beach view. The only suggestion for the hotel would be to have some outlets easy to get to. It was difficult to find one to charge phone and iPad. Will come back with the family.

Lovely stay. The Ritz Carlton has it all. I enjoyed a morning swim in the pristine pool and work out in the well equiped gym. The beach is right there beautifully prepared dotted with sun beds and kind guys attending to your needs. The suite was wonderful like an apartment with balconies on both sides with amazing views of the ocean. The breakfast is however not included in your rate and is on the expencive side. The location is great. Close to shopping at Bal Harbour and easy access to wherever you want to go. Friendly staff. Recomendable.

Convenient to all. Nice hotel that has been updated to more modern Ritz than is known as old luxurious. The rooms are roomy updated furniture with large bathrooms with separate toilet and shower areas with marble floors and counters. Amenities are good bed was comfortable pillows soft and mushy. My husband likes a firmer pillow and they accommodated us with a makeshift firm pillow which did the job and Will even made sure it suited us with a followup call the next day. Adriel at the front desk was so nice and he upgraded us to a partial ocean view room. The concierge recommend places to suit us foodies. They were spot on. The property has nice Pool and gym and is at the end of Lincoln Rd where all the shopping is and close to restaurants.

Perfect. I stayed two nights attending a series of business meetings in the hotels meeting rooms. I have stayed at several Ritz Carlton properties and this one does not disappoint. The location is as close to perfect as you can get it is a few steps from the beachfront with a private beach club and the hotel is at the oceanside end of the Lincoln Road shopping street. There are plenty of restaurants and clubs within walking distance. The property feels like it is from a bit older functionalist architecture era like many buildings on South Beach. This is not a bad thing as the hotel was in top shape but room was a bit small there was very little room to walk around the bed. The bathroom was quite big with double sink setup. The gym was functional and good sized with lots of cardio equipment of the main types and a separate room for weight training. There was hardly anyone at the gym the three times I used it and I never had to wait to use the machines. There is a big pool area with a huge main pool and lots of lounge chairs. Again I could take my pick of the loungers and the servers were very quick to bring me a drink and had even closed the tab for me anticipating my needs. The service was friendly and professional throughout. The meeting rooms were a bit too cold due to a technical problem but the hotel team was very attentive and apologetic of the issue. I did not use the restaurants or bars but the food catered in the meeting rooms was fantastic with lots of Cuban flavors. If you are looking for a small luxury hotel on South Beach with an understated boutique feel you can not go wrong with Ritz Carlton.

The love and I went to get a massage which was his first experience getting a massage and our first time as a guest but we both left super disappointed not because of the massage but because my wallet got stolen inside the womens locker room at the Spa. I wanted to speak to a manager and I was told that there was no manager on duty which I find very weird. Especially when it was not just me that the wallet got stolen there was one more person that also got her wallet stolen at the same time and of course on the same day. Explain how that can be. All I was told that our services was paid for but that was all that they can do for us which I find extremely wrong and unprofessional how a hotel so known can let things like this happen to their guest. They truly do not care and I will definitely call corporate.

Top service. Ritz is a certainty for service. Spacious room with pool view. Breakfast is super for those who are not lazy I suggest to avoid room service breakfast and go to the restaurant and have breakfast at the pool it is fantasticI also tried the SPA. highly recomendedThe service at the pool and at the beach is super the guys are super careful in order to satisfy all your needs.

Nice hotel great location. security poor at night. Nice location decent rooms should be getting balcony for priceWe had a very unpleasant experience at night whereby a random person homeless managed to get into the hotel from off the street and then the pool area and treat herself to the hot tub spa our kids where in the pool spa at the time she must have sat speaking to them for a good 10mins before we gathered that she was not a hotel guest which she had proclaimed she was to the kids and was also under the influence of alcohol and drunk we reported her to the bar manager who alerted hotel security who then took some time to get to the pool they then ejected her from the property she was like a wild cat when leaving the property. Although the kids were really upset nothing serious happened but it could have been terrible given the fact that no one new this persons history. We had a chat in the morning with head of security who was obviously concerned how the person got in past security and then assured us that the hotel was safe and secure. That was about it from the hotel we got the impression it was brushed under the carpet and heard nothing else no apology upon checkout no face to face with the manager at the time or upon checkout a really bad service and I struggle to say that I would stay in the hotel again let alone a Ritz Carlton hotel. on top of this they had the cheek to charge me 9 to print off 9 x tickets for the basketball which was really poor given what we had been through.

The most inconsistent Ritz we have ever been to. This hotel perplexed us as a total set of contrasts and contradictions fabulous pool and beach mediocre service incredible staff member one moment in the restaurant the next day someone that is the opposite helpful and smiling folks at the front desk but not much focus on sincerely resolving issues great spa in a temporary facility. The overall hotel property is quite nice rooms are small especially if you are going with kids as we did. We had 2 major issues one of which was solved when we were there albeit it took 24 hours and was based on an issue with the way I made our reservation that Ritz did not catch until we checked in I made it 6 weeks in advance for a rolaway since we have two twen kids but the hotel would not grant it based on the room type the first night and the other went unacknowledged significant noise all night in the room next door on our last night prompting me to call the front desk for some relief and concern for safety despite my post stay survey. In defense of the hotel it was Veterans Day weekend and the hotel was at 95 occupancy due to a large wedding. However that does not really explain that service gaps. All in all a decent place but not in the same experience class as our other stays around the world at Ritz Four Seasons and Park Hyat Grand Hyat even though it was awfully expensive.

One of the Best. Easy review. 1. Staff service is extraordinary. 2. Has the best concierge lounge of any Ritz that we have stayed at. 3 Is a classy and elegant oasis in the heart of South Beach. This is probably the tenth time we have stayed at this Ritz newly renovated spa and lounge expected to open soon. Ca nt wait to go back.

Ritz Carlton South Beach. Staff at hotel very nice and professional. Hotel rooms need a serious upgrade. Spa facility was terrible. Spa treatment s were ok. Location of hotel is the main advantage. Pool was nice and service there was good In general hotel staff were very nice.

Does not live up to the reputation of the brand. The service at this hotel does not in any way live up to the reputation established by the Ritz Carlton name. I have stayed in Ritz Carlton hotels on both coasts and in between. Never have I seen such lackadaisical service. Upon leaving Key West I used the highly touted mobile ap to check into the hotel. We arrived four hours later and waited in line to get to the desk to speak to one of the hotel associates. Despite having used the mobile check in function on the ap the process to actually receive a key to the room from an associate was a lengthy and tedious process. There is no separate check in location for mobile check in at this Ritz. After finally wading through the check in process the young lady at the desk informed us she would need to walk us to the room to show us how to get there. With two suitcases two carry on bags and hanging clothes we trudged across the lobby. After traversing the lobby being led by the Ritz associate we arrived at a short flight of stairs where we were forced to carry unassisted our belongings up the flight to a further walk to an elevator. We boarded the elevator and went up two floors where we carried our belongings past the spa and through a hallway of meeting rooms and guest rooms to another elevator which we boarded and descended one floor. We then exited the hallway and walked down another hallway of guestrooms before finally arriving at our room. Upon opening the door one could not help but noticed the frayed carpet in the entry portion of the room. We quickly changed clothes and headed to the beach. The beach attendant very quickly arranged our chairs and towels doing a wonderful job. We mentioned to him we would like to order food and beverage and he assured us he would send someone to take our order. 30 minutes passed and we had yet to see anyone with whom we could place an order. I finally walked back to the area where the towels were and found someone to take our snack order. We then left the beach and stopped in the downstairs restaurant for a meal. After giving our name and room number we were seated where we waited for service. The waiter finally approached our table and begrudgingly took our order not once during the entire meal did he address us by our name which I know to be something Ritz Carlton instills in their employees. After eating we asked for a glass of water. You would have thought we had asked the waiter to consume the contents of the Atlantic Ocean using a straw. As I write this I anticipate a canned reply from management copied and pasted word for word as seems to be their practice at this hotel. Even the responses from management lack the personal attention to detail Ritz Carlton has provided me and millions of other guests at the numerous locations in which I have stayed. In short it is borderline fraud for the name Ritz Carlton to be attached to this chain. It is sad that customers come to this location to stay thinking they are truly staying at a Ritz. They will be missing out on what makes the brand so well loved the wonderful service and attention to detail. Anyone who has come to trust the Ritz brand as I have will be sorely disappointed. I will continue to stay at Ritz Carlton hotels elsewhere but there are far better choices in South Beach.

Mold in Parm fries but still 5. I will tell you all the great things first. Lovely stunning property on the beach. Interior and exterior public spaces large and opulent. I had a lanai suite at the end of the hall nearest the beach with spectacular views of beach and ocean and a huge wrap around terrace. do not miss the spa. I had the best facial and outdoor massage ever. The massage would have been incredibly awesome inside too. Mabel is quite talented and ever so efficient. I saw they did outdoor massages on the website so I was eager to partake. After a great thorough facial I schleped in bathrobe and slippers down corridors and through the pool area to the very end close to the beach. It turns out my suite was just above but I had not checked in yet. There was disco Caribbean music surrounding us from a neighbouring property and delicious mouthwatering scents wafting through the music. Welcome to Miami. The massage was great. I totally de stressed as Mabel found places that needed attention that I was not aware. Then she topped it with a chilling yet very appreciated cool spray of a high SPF lotion and massaged it in to my warming epidermis. Elegant and naughty. Let me emphasise that this was the best massage I have ever had and if you read my other reviews I have had many. Alonso at the spa desk was quite helpful in arranging everything and the staff sent up a lovely gift to welcome me to the suite. Posh touch. ThanksA la carte breakfast at the pool both mornings was great. Sitting on the beach in the late afternoon was also lovely with bar service expensive but hey it is the Ritz and it is South Beach. I had emailed the concierge desk about renting a sailboat with Captain and they never replied so I finally called and they gave me prices upwards of 4 grand for a day. I looked on trip advisor and found a great private boat with captain for around 400. Check my reviews for that. do not miss it. I ordered a room service burger and Parmesan fries. Burger was great. I noticed some moldy bits in the cheese. I mentioned this in the online survey I received after my stay was was told a general reply Thank you for taking the time to complete a survey and allowing me to contact you directly about the challenges you faced during your recent stay. I would like to take this opportunity to apologize for the problems that you have experienced. Please know that we are taking measures to ensure that this situation does not reocur. We really appreciate your feedback and your loyalty and we are looking forward to welcoming you again and provide you a perfect experience. Please let me know next time you plan to visit us I would like to assist you personally and ensure your stay is nothing but perfect. I spent over 1k a night for the room and about 500 on spa services only to get a copy paste reply. Totally dissatisfied disappointed with superior management. The hotel itself is grand. it is not the stuffy usual RC but has a cool younger hip vibe. I highly recommend it and would repeat. Not the fries however.

Fairy Tale. This has been my favorite birthday ever. The big 4 0. I spent my birthday at the Ritz. I was first at this property when it opened in 204. I was like 25 years old and I always said that I wanted to come back. like it literally beckoned me. I had been fantasizing about returning there since 204. There is definitely something fairy tale ish. I do not know why I have been so drawn to the property. It was like a beacon or a siren singing to me. I knew that is where I needed to be for my birthday. I planned it for over a year. From the room I would just look out the window at the ocean thinking of how much has changed since 204 in my life. and also in the hotel. When I was there in 204 there was more of a nautical feel blue stripes and royal blue cushions on the pool chairs. Now the rooms are more subdued. The designers did an excellent job to capture the essence of south beach with the light bone walls light blue accents on the tan sand ish color textured carpets. Apparently the owner curated all of the art work in the hotel. I love it. So tasteful stylish and elegant not some sort of replica of boring French impressionists or cliche anonymous photos of the beach or somethingThe Ritz is more classic luxury rather than the transitory design of the Edition or the One Hotel. Those hotels are so overly stylized. I feel like I am in an Ele Decor story from 3 years ago. I can digress. Waffle robes gorgeous and clean rooms and property. The service is impeccable. The staff seems to really enjoy their work here. The staff at the Ritz phenomenal. They seem like that they all love their jobs. They are so genuinely thoughtful and intentional without any arrogance or pretension. such amazing service. The weather was so miserable outside rained for practically our entire staybut inside the Ritz SoBe it is a perfect sunshiney day and some rainbows. The trip was flawless because of the team and elegant property. I always reach out to the hotel properties before we arrive. I just wanted to make sure to inoculate with our demands vegan ritz kids defeathering etc since we had such a horrific experience at a hotel last summer. We were miserable. I tried to analyze what my part responsibility was in that disaster. I realized that I should have called ahead and maybe some of the annoyances could have been avoided. So now I call or email with hotel properties so things are all arranged for when we get there eg Where to watch the UFC fights or dinner reservations. so when we arrive on the vacation we can just lay back and enjoy our stay and not complain etc. Well everything was perfect. The hotel exceeded every expectation with many big surprises. I am beyond a satisfied customer. From the bottom of my heart. This was such an unforgettable vacation. This will always be a highlight in our blessed lives. We are fortunate to have the privilege to even be able to stay at a place like the Ritz. We savored every second. Everyone that I interacted with from the concierge front desk restaurant spa pool beach house cleaning door people were so pleasant and cheerful. So lovely. Management did a great job at hiring and retaining staff. There is obviously some ethos there that really works. Scott Brian Juan Jose Juan Richmond have gone above and beyond to accommodate us. I am stunned. We were literally showered us with personalized custom luxuries. Couture. Bespoke. Beyond fairy tale. The experience was beyond my wildest dreams. I felt like I was Anie and I showed up to Daddy War bucks home. I mentioned that to a staff member. and then I received a copy of the DVD with a note from the manager in our room. I enjoyed watching the movie. I will cherish this memory of receiving the thoughtful gesture and then watching the film with my family while eating the amazing coconut sorbet from room service. They make the sorbet in the hotel. So delicious. One of the best things is staying in hotels with kids going to the pool ordering room service watching movies. The property is the best resort hotel in south beach for families. This trip exceeded my expectations. Our son went to Ritz Kids for the day times. The staff provided several wholesome activities and he is bringing home a bunch of arts and crafts and memories. My husband and I got to spend quality time together. The beach is gorgeous and accessible. Great chairs. Umbrella. Virgin pina coladas served right to me on the beach. Cool ice buckets for water bottles The hotel manager Scott is always around on campus. It is apparent that he has hands on ethos that is so laudable. it is no surprise that the staff reflect the same enthusiasm and philosophy. Everyone is alert approachable and intentional in their service. Such a pleasant group of people. Everyone from the housekeeping eg Milagros room service Ruben I think that is his name Consuelo the bell service Miguel and the pool beach staff the restaurants staff Nezo JP francis and the lovely hostess Brian the managerJP is the greatest I want to be friends with him the spa staff Jenifer Celia and Martha the front desk Richmond and all the staff. I can not remember the womans name from Rwanda she is the best. the store staff the woman on Monday afternoon gave my son a lion AJ the driver is like an uncle to us. The chefs and cooks anthony and Xavier particularly. In fact Anthony reached out to me before we arrived about our vegan diets. Boris we encountered him at Ritz Kids and with the cafecito hour is such a sweetheart. Everyone literally said please let us know if we can do anything for youAnd staff said please do not leave. We want you to stay. I am not sure if they really meant it but it felt heartfelt. We did not want to leave. We felt like we were leaving family. It sounds so cliche and cheesy we really felt like everyone was family Oh and Vegan Pancakes. Juan warmly greeted us when we arrived. I really enjoyed our conversation. He took time and showed us around the campus. The spa is gorgeous. Recently renovated. I do not even really like saunas. the RC sauna is so inviting. I loved it. Martha the spa attendant keeps the locker room and area so clean. she is also such a sweetie. She has been with the RC since they opened in south beach the staff longevity is amazing. The staff are very loyal to the property. For instance Kristen at the concierge has also been there since the opened. I love my girl Kristen. she is so much fun. I got the salt scrub and massage couples from Celia she was great. Very intuitive. I should have gone every day. my husband felt like his masseuse was not very good. He was very sore but not in a good sore way. Of course he did not tell me until we were checking out. On Tuesday night Noel concierge sent up balloons to the room for my birthday. How sweet. I love balloons. We called the front desk for blankets because we were cold. We received blankets and then a tray of warm cookies and tea showed up with a card. I think her name begins with an I. Well I called and she said that she sent them up because I had asked for blankets she thought that I might be cold could use some warm tea. Class act. Juan Jose the guest relations manager is incredible. he is a trouble shooter problem solver genie. he is intuitive and patient. He is responsive and responsible. He was on top of everything that we needed from Vegan food spa treatments pool ritz kids etc. he probably hates us because we were so annoying but he never showed it. Thank you Juan Jose. Juan Jose made us feel like we were the only guests there or that we were VIPs. and he had an entire orchestra of staff who made us feel the same way. Our family felt very special. We dream of returning one day. maybe we will get a windfall of cash some day and we will go back and live life to the fullest at the RC south beach. One note for renovations ditch the martini glass rugs on the mezzanine lounge And a note to travelers be extra kind to staff. I saw some difficult guests and I was horrified by their treatment to the staff. The staff have thick skins and they dealt with the guests with professional attentiveness. I was left feeling so down after witnessing the torture. The staff are wonderful and hardworking. They can not yell back at people or show that they are juggling a bunch of other things I admire their endurance. Also please leave tips even on top of the service charge. This industry lives off of tips. Carry cash around and be sure to tip the pool attendants spa attendants bell staff door people valet and beach attendants etc and enjoy every second of it. I wish I was there with you.

Amazing stay. Best hotel in Miami. From check in thank you Juan for the beautiful upgraded room to the Spa Edguardo is the BEST masseuse. So good that after a massage from him the day I checked in I booked with him for another massage then next evening. Not to mention I came during Miami Spa Week so the prices were fantastic. To the bartender Martin at the outside bar so friendly and nice and service above and beyond. Food was so delicious. best Ceviche I have had in a long time. All friendly staff except bartender at same outdoor bar not Martin but someone who was not friendly or helpful at all really not of RC standard for customer service but I discussed with Rebecca the restaurant manager on duty who made everything more than right so a BIG thank you and another hug to Rebecca. She ROCKS. And another big thanks to Krystal at the lobby bar. Had fun speaking with her and other guests and she really made the evening fun with the complimentary cocktails. I hope to be back soon.

Fantastic Visit. This hotel is in a perfect location. The lobby is very well appointed and comfortable. We arrived early about 12 noon and met with Jena at the desk. She was fantastic and knows the true meaning of hospitality. We left our luggage at the desk and headed to the spa for a massage and facial. The spa is very clean and the spa attendants are ready to help with every need. We felt so refreshed after the treatments and steam room. When I arrived back to my spa locker there was a voicemail as promised mentioning our room was ready. We went back to the front desk and was immediately greeted by Jena by name. She went over all the amenities of the property and pointed out all the locations. Our luggage was delivered to our room promptly and the bellman was polite and informative. Our room was very clean and well appointed. The beds are super comfortable and have fabulous feather beds. I was happy to meet Jena and Rebecca at the desk upon check out. Rebecca assisted me via phone a couple days prior to my arrival and was very helpful and pleasant. Thanks again ladies for making a much needed relaxation getaway seamless. I will be back.

Fantastic. This property is perfect for someone who just wants to relax and may not want to drive anywhere. The beach was amazing pool was fantastic and the restaurant was great. Just a few blocks up was the fabulous Lincoln st mall. It included a lot of ethnic restaurants of all types and great shopping. The spa was fabulous also. Rooms are comfortable had alitle trouble setting the ac low enough but over all it was fine. I had put my luggage in the closet which I do not recommend doing all my clothes smelled mildew within a few days. Probably due to humidity. Staff was all very nice. As I was trying to enjoy the spa after a great massage the fire alarm went off it kind of ruined the relaxation mode. Not sure if that happens a lot or not the way the staff acted it seemed like maybe it happens more often than not.

Girls Trip. The weather was not good but we still had a great time at the spa and enjoyed hanging out at the pool area and the hours that we are able to get. The hotel is located in a perfect location right by the beach in near shopping. It was nice being able to walk to restaurants and shopping as well as the movie theater since the weather did not cooperate. Staff cater to every need and was very responsive.

I usually love this place and Scott and Richard at the pool are awesome. But after spending 400 at the spa we were denied access to the pool area because we were not registered guests. I guess I take my spa money somewhere else next time. Way to treat a Mariot Elite member.

I usually love this place and Scott and Richard at the pool are awesome. But after spending 400 at the spa we were denied access to the pool area because we were not registered guests. I guess I take my spa money somewhere else next time. Way to treat a Mariot Elite member.

Bliss on the beach. The Ritz Carlton SoBe is finally reopenedI literally walked by in horror about 20 times during it ’s 2 12 year repair and renovation. I made certain to plan my return stay asap after reopening. Emily in guest relations made certain I had the perfect room. THANK YOU. My lanai room had a blissful pool partial ocean view on the 4th floor. Beautifully appointed with plenty of seating including three chairs and two bedside ottomans. Redecorated flawlessly with lovely white paneled walls and soft touches including area rugs in the bedding area. The lanai was refurnished with a lounge chair table and two patio chairs. The spa was also beautifully refurbished. But I did n’t see another guest in there 6 days in a row. Dining was very pleasant as well. The new lobby bar is very inviting and the resort fee includes two house punch drinks per day. Great place to take in the historic lobby. Also Josh rooms controller was very helpful with club access. I just had to check out the newly remodeled club. It was very quite and the club manager was clearly one of the handful of the leadership team that came from another Ritz Carlton property. The fitness center which I used everyday was about the same. It could definitely use more equipment. One gentlemen truly stood out. Emanuel at the pool had my chair set up in my favorite spot 30 minutes before I arrived at the pool each day. This is exactly what Ritz Carlton service is about. Perfect example of anticipation of guest needs. Top talent is hard to find in Miami and especially Ritz Carlton level of service. This is something you just understand or you don’t. There were a few bumps with housekeeping and inexperienced front desk staff but this is perfectly understandable as they just opened and the previous staff mostly did not return. Also the pool manager was very welcoming as he has greeted me by name for at least ten years. I have stayed here well over 100 nights and I am titanium. I felt very appreciated and recognized as a return guest. My only questionable take away is that the hotel was kind of slow especially the spa. There did n’t seem to be any grand reopening spa or dining promos. I thought that was odd. This study was magical and I already have three return reservation before summer. This is my favorite Ritz Carlton in the USThank you to the gracious stafGregory S.
